data.title: AnimationController::IsPlaying returns false
data.body:
I was playing with CrowdNavigation sample and noticed a small minor bug.
On Windows we can use "\" or "/" in paths so if I define an animation path like this:

`static const char* WALKING_ANI = "Models\\Jack_Walk.ani";`

I'll be able to use it in `animCtrl->Play(WALKING_ANI);` and it'll work, but
`animCtrl->IsPlaying(WALKING_ANI)` will always return false (obviously because Urho3D normalized the path).

data.title: added final mutant animations
data.body:
-added 2 layer animations
-and with this, the mutant sample animation set is complete

data.title: E_PHYSICSBEGINCONTACT2D should be send through participating nodes.
data.body: As of now, `E_PHYSICSBEGINCONTACT2D` and `E_PHYSICSENDCONTACT2D` are only send globally, not through the participating nodes. This means objects have to subscribe to all events and filter out everything in which they are not involved.

data.title: fixed channelIndices[] indexing in ExpandAnimatedChannelKeys() func.
data.body: -also removed dbg dump code and minor spelling changes

data.title: Wrong color as in material
data.body:
Hello,

I've created a simple cube and applied a material in Blender.
The diffuse color is #DDC9B4 with an intensity of 1. The specular and ambient light is disabled.
When I import this model and material in my Urho3D scene it shows a **wrong color**.

What should I change to get the **exact(!) color code** from Urho3D as I set **in my material**?

My (only) light is a directional light facing down with a brightness of 1, color white and alpha 1.
Distance between camera and plane (cube) doesn't change anything. I think the directional light does not have a position, right?

In this image you can see my target color (left) and the color I get from my scene (right).
![002 coloroffset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9771909/17871166/b1e297f0-68ba-11e6-80e5-1b412c813604.png)

The exact color codes are:
- Current: #CBA480 (R: 203, G: 164, B: 128)
- Target: #DDC9B4 (R: 221, G: 201, B: 180)

I hope someone can help me, Simon :)

data.title: added a feature to suppress $fbx nodes in assetImporter
data.body: If an fbx model contains non-reset bone transforms (non-zero or having pivot point) it will generate multiple $AssimpFbx$ nodes per bone.  Because of this some Mixamo characters will generate near 200 bones per model which will fail to animate the characters correctly, not to mention the over head it causes to interpolate all these bones at run time.

data.title: Material->Clone() crashes application
data.body:
Hello,

my application is always crashing when I clone a material. I took the "First Project" code and changed a few lines and got the same issue:

```
Material* defaultBoxMaterial = cache->GetResource<Material>("Materials/Stone.xml");
Material* clonedMaterial = defaultBoxMaterial->Clone();
boxObject->SetMaterial(clonedMaterial);
```

What is wrong about this code? Maybe someone can try it out if it's only crashing on my machine? Code is [here](http://hastebin.com/usoxequfim.cpp) (Line 145-147).

Urho3D.log is [here](http://hastebin.com/zuromanoyu).

Running from console results in this:
![screenshot_20160820_182409](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9771909/17832447/6f07c03a-6703-11e6-9898-3cb5f7338490.png)

Thanks for any help, Simon :)

data.title: FindUrho3D.cmake not considering MinGW as multilib capable in places.
data.body:
CMake is not finding any Urho3D libraries, even when the libraries are smack-dab visible in a `lib` folder in the given `URHO3D_HOME` directory. It's not discovering `URHO3D_LIB_TYPE`, either, which might be connected.

I found this interesting tidbit in `FindUrho3D.cmake`, though, right before Urho3D determines the library type, at line 171:

```
foreach (ABI_64BIT RANGE ${URHO3D_64BIT} 0)
    # Break if the compiler is not multilib-capable and the ABI is not its native
    if ((MSVC OR MINGW OR ANDROID OR ARM OR WEB) AND NOT ABI_64BIT EQUAL NATIVE_64BIT)
        break ()
    endif ()
```

Recently, MinGW compilers were found to be multilib-capable (well, at least TDM-GCC and MinGW-w64) and are allowed to set the `URHO3D_64BIT` option how they want.

Could this be the cause?

data.title: Cannot build Urho3D in 32 bit mode, even with URHO3D_64BIT set to false.
data.body:
I'm probably missing something, but I can't for the life of me figure out how to get Urho3D built in 32 bit mode. I ran CMake with `-DURHO3D_64BIT=0` and even still the resulting library is 64 bit.

Out of frustration I just hacked up URHO3D_64BIT and set it to false in the `Urho3D-CMake-common` module.

Can anyone help me figure out why setting the build option isn't working, though? Also, shouldn't it be user-specifiable (if the user is running 64 bit)?

data.body:
Hello,

I wanted to try out Urho3D and took this [one-file-example](http://urho3d.wikia.com/wiki/First_Project) (v 1.5!).

Everything working but these 900 boxes are not shown and there are some warnings in the console:

```
[Wed Aug 17 16:31:40 2016] WARNING: Found vertex attribute iInstanceMatrix1 with no known semantic in shader program LitSolid(INSTANCED) LitSolid(DIFFMAP)
[Wed Aug 17 16:31:40 2016] WARNING: Found vertex attribute iInstanceMatrix2 with no known semantic in shader program LitSolid(INSTANCED) LitSolid(DIFFMAP)

[Wed Aug 17 16:31:40 2016] WARNING: Found vertex attribute iInstanceMatrix2 with no known semantic in shader program LitSolid(INSTANCED NORMALMAP PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT) LitSolid(AMBIENT DIFFMAP NORMALMAP PACKEDNORMAL PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT SPECULAR)
[Wed Aug 17 16:31:40 2016] WARNING: Found vertex attribute iInstanceMatrix3 with no known semantic in shader program LitSolid(INSTANCED NORMALMAP PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT) LitSolid(AMBIENT DIFFMAP NORMALMAP PACKEDNORMAL PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT SPECULAR)
[Wed Aug 17 16:31:40 2016] WARNING: Found vertex attribute iInstanceMatrix1 with no known semantic in shader program LitSolid(INSTANCED NORMALMAP PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT) LitSolid(DIFFMAP NORMALMAP PACKEDNORMAL PERPIXEL POINTLIGHT SPECULAR)

```

This example was built for Urho3D v1.5, my system is:
- Urho3D Shared 1.6
- Linux x64 (Kubuntu 16.04)

Am I missing something?
Thanks for every help, Simon

data.title: Fixed the possibility of node collision event normalB not matching nodeB
data.body:
This problem always existed as far as I can remember, and I used to work around it by using the direction between the nodes instead of the contact normal (which aren't the same).

When I reload a level (first load is consistent AFAIR) sometimes the normals of contacts flip. It only happens after reloading a level, possibly because the order of the bodies changes.

In `Urho3D::PhysicsWorld::SendCollisionEvents()` the order of the bodies A and B may be flipped to ensure unique pairs, so original A becomes new B and original B becomes new A, but the contactManifold's points' `m_normalWorldOnB` stays the same, and later on when collision event's contacts_ is populated it handles the normals according to the new A & B while the normals are according to the original A & B.

The contact points' normals can't be flipped directly because it seems Bullet still uses them (tried that and it caused bodies to wiggle).
A possible solution is to track if the order of the bodies was flipped, and take that into account when populating the event data's contacts_ by flipping the normals too (tried it and it worked).

Also, does Bullet generate duplicate contactManifolds? If it doesn't it may be possible to avoid using a HashMap for the purpose of iteration, thus needing to reorder the bodies, and that would be a more efficient solution.
I do see that the HashMap is used for lookup to check if a previousCollisions_ ended.

A simple alternative way to do that is to use both a vector for iteration, and a HashMap for checking against previous collisions, which would be possibly faster too.

A better is to send the events from inside the contactManifolds loop and using the original A & B bodies, removing the need to iterate over the HashMap all together, which is also faster.
I tried it with my project and some of the Urho samples and it seems to work fine, suggesting Bullet doesn't generate duplicate manifolds.
This is the solution in this pull request (this post was originally written as an issue).

data.title: replaced jack model w/ mutant model in 18 character demo
Undefined symbol "__cpu_model" when libUrho3D.so is built using GCC 5.4 or higher
data.body:
The following ldd command confirms the issue: `ldd -d libUrho3D.so`
The problematic shared library will produce error when being used by application in linking phase.

```
hidden symbol `__cpu_model' in /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/6.1.1/libgcc.a(cpuinfo.o) is referenced by DSO
```

Workaround step can be found in #1499.

data.title: Add option to build 32 bit version of Urho3D library.
data.body:
Right now, the CMake build system doesn't expose a build option that controls whether the library built will be 32 bit or 64 bit. It seems 64 bit-ness is automatically decided by the build system.

This ability might be useful, since I might want to build a 32 bit version even if I am running a 64 bit OS.

data.title: Make different icons for unknown components and components without icon
data.body:
Now all components in Editor have '?' icon if they don't have another one.
It would be cool to have different icons for unknown components and components without icon.

data.title: render UI to multiple viewports
data.body:
according to http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1000.html (
Oculus Rift support ), I can successfully render one scene to two viewports by the following code: 
renderer.viewports[0] = Viewport(scene, left_eye_camera,IntRect(0, 0, graphics.width /2, graphics.height)); 
renderer.viewports[1] = Viewport(scene, right_eye_camera,IntRect(graphics.width /2, 0,graphics.width, graphics.height)); 
But I cannot find any methods to render UI  to multiple viewports. 
How can I do so in Urho3D? 
Also, if rendering one scene to two viewports, the FPS drops around one third, even if I use SetCullCamera. Are there any tricks to improve the performance during this scenario? Thank you for your reply.

data.title: CMake configuration error: get_filename_component
data.body:
Hello. I'm getting an error trying to build my project with Urho3D (not Urho3D itself), and this error pops up for me:

```
CMake Error at cmake/modules/FindUrho3D.cmake:201 (get_filename_component):
  get_filename_component unknown component C:/Projects/Game
  Development/Engines/Urho3D-1.6-Build/lib/libUrho3D_d.a
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:29 (find_package)
```

I'm using Urho3D based off of the 1.6 release tag (`e2bad7d`).

Changing line 201 from
`get_filename_component (EXT ${URHO3D_LIBRARIES} EXT)`
to
`get_filename_component (EXT ${URHO3D_LIBRARIES_DBG} EXT)`
fixes the error, magically.

I also noticed that `URHO3D_LIB_TYPE` is a `BOOL` value in my `CMakeCache.txt`? But it is set to `STATIC`.

If you need any more information please ask.

data.title: TileMapLayer2D::GetObject (index) function name conflict
data.body:
TileMapLayer2D::GetObject (index) can not be used on MinGW because it conflicts with GetObject macro in wingdi.h (line 3309) and causes linker error when I build my project (Urho3D builds successfully). It can be fixed by setting URHO3D_WIN32_CONSOLE=1.

 But I think it will be good if TileMapLayer2D::GetObject (index) will be renamed to, for example, TileMapLayer2D::GetLayerObject (index), because in my opinion using URHO3D_WIN32_CONSOLE for all windows projects with tile maps is not a good solution.

P.S. My system configuration:
- Windows 7 SP1
- MinGW 4.9.2 (i686-4.9.2-posix-dwarf-rt_v3-rev1)
- CMake 3.6.0
- Urho3D version is release 1.6.

data.title: Missing MarkNetworkUpdate of Component in Node::AddChild
data.body:
I've tried to move Node with some components from one Scene to another, but it ended with crash in 
Serializable.cpp:742
`const AttributeInfo& attr = attributes->At(i);`
`if (networkState_->currentValues_[i] != attr.defaultValue_)`
        `attributeBits.Set(i);`

due to inconsistent number of attributes(which is many) and size of currentValues_(which is 0).
I figured, that manually invoking MarkNetworkUpdate on every component of Node fixes the problem.
Can I add this change to Node::AddChild? Something like this
`for (unsigned i = 0; i < components_.Size(); ++i)`
   `components_[i]->MarkNetworkUpdate();`
